commitResults.messageTitle: Rename Duke to Alexer and add some features
commitResults.messageBody: Alexer will be able to greet users and say goodbye.

commitResults.messageTitle: Create scanner and add prompt loop
commitResults.messageBody:
This is to prepare for adding the echo feature, which
requires continuous reading of user input until the text
"bye" has been entered.

commitResults.messageTitle: Make scanner final
commitResults.messageBody: The scanner will be reused throughout the lifetime of the chatbot

commitResults.messageTitle: Add method to greet user and create an instance of chatbot
commitResults.messageBody:
This is so that we can add more methods and
state to the chatbot later on.

commitResults.messageTitle: Move printing goodbye message to own function
commitResults.messageBody: This will make the code more modular in the long term.

commitResults.messageTitle: Change function ordering for chatbot actions
commitResults.messageBody: Ideally functions should be defined above where they are used.

commitResults.messageTitle: Create list for simple tasks and function to print them
commitResults.messageBody:
This uses a Java Collection (ArrayList) to store some simple tasks with
only the name, as well as a function to print these tasks numbered.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add logic to create new tasks and list them
commitResults.messageBody: This adds some cool new features to the chatbot.

commitResults.messageTitle: Refactor adding task logic to its own function
commitResults.messageBody: This improves code abstraction and separation of concerns

commitResults.messageTitle: Break up input into to commands and use switch case
commitResults.messageBody:
Using switch case will allow for more flexibility as the number
of actions increases, and separating the command out from the
input allows better parsing for future use.

commitResults.messageTitle: Create task class that describes a task
commitResults.messageBody:
Our initial task consist of a task description, as well
as a boolean field to indicate whether the task is done.

There are also some helper methods to abstract commonly
used logic to make life easier later on.

commitResults.messageTitle: Convert primitive task list to use Task class
commitResults.messageBody:
This offers more extensibility to tasks, such as added the task state
(done/not done) and possibly different types of tasks in future.

commitResults.messageTitle: Make chatbot more lively
commitResults.messageBody: Add more interesting prompts and responses from the chatbot

commitResults.messageTitle: Improve parsing of command and its arguments
commitResults.messageBody: This is to better prepare for command argument usage

commitResults.messageTitle: Add command to mark task as done
commitResults.messageBody:
For this naive implementation all inputs are assumed to be
valid and error handling will be performed in a later part.

commitResults.messageTitle: Include functionality to unmark done tasks as not done
commitResults.messageBody: If you can mark tasks as done, why can't you unmark them?

commitResults.messageTitle: Return nothing as marking task is an action
Create more specialised subclasses of Task
commitResults.messageBody: This will be used for future implementations

commitResults.messageTitle: List out the number of tasks after adding a task
Add specialization to the Task subclasses
commitResults.messageBody:
Deadlines now have a deadline parameter, and events have 2 new
parameters indicating the time from the event start to the event end.

commitResults.messageTitle: Improve code formatting
commitResults.messageBody: Move the newline part into a separate line.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add ability to create todos in the chatbot
commitResults.messageBody:
This is similar to addTask() but instead parses
 the command arguments directly.

commitResults.messageTitle: Include indentation when printing out tasks
Add ability to add deadlines to the task list
commitResults.messageBody:
The addDeadline() function will process the input arguments to
know the deadline and description of the task, and create the
deadline task accordingly.

commitResults.messageTitle: Allow creation of event tasks in todo list
commitResults.messageBody:
Similar to how addDeadline() works, we parse the arguments
by finding the index where the keywords appear and
subsection the arguments accordingly.

commitResults.messageTitle: Remove escaped characters in chatbot wordart
commitResults.messageBody: This may cause issues with tests later on.

commitResults.messageTitle: Fix testing code to run correct class
Update tests with input and expected output
Add error handling for some cases
commitResults.messageBody:
Handle the case where the command is not found
and where the todo description is empty

commitResults.messageTitle: Add ability to delete tasks
commitResults.messageBody:
This is similar to how marking tasks work in terms of parsing
which task in mentioned, and removes the task accordingly

commitResults.messageTitle: Update tests with more test cases
commitResults.messageBody: Support level 5 and level 6 features

commitResults.messageTitle: Create an enum for different task types
commitResults.messageBody: This is so we can easily differentiate task types in future.

commitResults.messageTitle: Make a task manager to handle all task related matters
commitResults.messageBody:
This improves our code abstractions and allow for
easier extension such as saving and loading

commitResults.messageTitle: Add convenience function to print chatbot response
commitResults.messageBody: This will allow better abstraction of printing replies.

commitResults.messageTitle: Refactor chatbot to use task manager class
commitResults.messageBody:
By using task manager, we apply more OOP principles in our code. 
Added a new method in task manager as well.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add method to convert a task (and subtask) to a string
commitResults.messageBody: This is to allow saving of tasks later on.

commitResults.messageTitle: Create public method to save all tasks to file
commitResults.messageBody:
This creates and overwrite the task save file to populate
 it with all the current tasks serialised.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add static constructor to create task from task string
commitResults.messageBody: This is so that we can load the task from task strings.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add new method to load tasks in task manager
Handle errors when loading tasks from disk
commitResults.messageBody:
Inform the user if we are unable to find the save file to load,
as well as when we have successfully loaded all the saved tasks.

commitResults.messageTitle: Fix missing newline after each task string in save file
Check if save folder exist otherwise create it
commitResults.messageBody: Here we use the folder "data" to save the tasks.

commitResults.messageTitle: Fix task manager only loading a single task
commitResults.messageBody: All the task strings in the save file should be processed

commitResults.messageTitle: Update test data and expected output
commitResults.messageBody:
This is so that we can handle saved tasks correctly
and ensure consistent results

commitResults.messageTitle: Load tasks when chatbot starts and save tasks accordingly
Merge branch 'branch-Level-7'
Add date time processing to deadline
commitResults.messageBody: Show deadline tasks with formatting date time string.

commitResults.messageTitle: Include error handling for when an invalid date is loaded
commitResults.messageBody: Skip the loading of the task for invalid dates.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add brackets to if statement to conform to style guide
Refactor task loading to skip tasks that failed to load
commitResults.messageBody: This is when the task is null, we just skip the test

commitResults.messageTitle: Update test with a proper date time in deadline task
Merge branch 'branch-Level-8'
Move setting up of chatbot to own method
commitResults.messageBody: This reduces the amount of code in the main function.

commitResults.messageTitle: Use the new printResponse method instead
commitResults.messageBody:
Since we have already abstracted the printing method,
we shall use that instead

commitResults.messageTitle: Initialise fields explicitly in constructor and create instance
commitResults.messageBody:
We create a reference of the instance itself (singleton) that can
be used by other classes to access the chatbot.

commitResults.messageTitle: Create new prompter class to handle bot responses and output
commitResults.messageBody:
This class mainly serves to handle whatever the user sees on
their screen, i.e. the output of the chatbot and messages.

commitResults.messageTitle: Use prompter class to handle interaction responses
commitResults.messageBody:
This will be the start of slowly using methods from
prompter class to handle bot output

commitResults.messageTitle: Fix method to get instance of chat bot
commitResults.messageBody:
The method should be static so it is a class
method instead of an instance method.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add more public methods to access various parts of the chatbot
Add a basic command handler and base command class
commitResults.messageBody:
For the command class, we use an abstract class to ensure that it has to
be implemented by a subclass (which is the actual command).

The command handler is responsible for managing all the commands in the chatbot.

commitResults.messageTitle: Convert listing task operation to a command
commitResults.messageBody: Also registers the command with the command handler.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add method to print task list in prompter
Fix list task command to print correctly formatted tasks
Create the command handler instance and use it
commitResults.messageBody: Processing our first command!

These added tasks check for valid and invalid save inputs when
loading, as well as command handler to handle if command does
not exist

Ensure jar name is correct for output jar
Convert event task timings to final

For public methods missing javadoc, they will be deprecated 
and refactored later on so the javadocs 
will appear in their new locations.

Add javadoc for task subpackage
Convert wildcard import to imports
Add new method to print the list of filtered tasks
Provide a way to obtain task description from task
Create method to find a list of tasks containing keyword
Add a new command to find tasks
commitResults.messageBody: This command has the name "find" and takes a single argument keyword to search for the task.

Update CLI tests and ensure tests work

Create a basic graphical user interface to display

Add code to automatically scroll to bottom and move classes
commitResults.messageBody: Move the gui package to ui as it all belongs under user interface.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add formatting for GUI message box
Create response class to handle chatbot interactions
commitResults.messageBody:
This class contains a wrapper around the response to be
displayed to the screen (for GUI) or the console (text)

commitResults.messageTitle: Migrate chatbot response to use the new class
Refactor the chatbot to separate out the text-based methods
Refactor the main prompt loop used for text-based to its own method
commitResults.messageBody:
This allows usage of the chatbot instance for the GUI mode,
and at the same time preserving the text-based functionality.

commitResults.messageTitle: Render a testing message box in GUI with user avatar
Add ability to flip the message box when it is created by the bot
commitResults.messageBody:
This adds 2 static constructors to create a message box for the
respective roles in the chat bot, i.e. the user and the bot.

The bot's dialog also has the image and text order
reversed to be different than the user.

commitResults.messageTitle: Process user input for GUI and render on the screen
Add new main window class for GUI with FXML
commitResults.messageBody:
This uses FXML to define our window and render
regions instead of doing it programatically.

commitResults.messageTitle: Refactor the GUI application to use FXML and reduce code amount
Fix double execution of prompt loop method
Setup and start the chat bot for GUI mode
Create response class to handle chatbot interactions
commitResults.messageBody:
This class contains a wrapper around the response to be
displayed to the screen (for GUI) or the console (text)

commitResults.messageTitle: Migrate chatbot response to use the new class
Refactor commands to return a response
commitResults.messageBody:
The response contains the output of the chat bot
that can then be displayed back to the user.

commitResults.messageTitle: Refactor the chatbot to separate out the text-based methods
Refactor the main prompt loop used for text-based to its own method
commitResults.messageBody:
This allows usage of the chatbot instance for the GUI mode,
and at the same time preserving the text-based functionality.

Use varargs for command arguments

This formats the code and improve styling for all non-command
classes.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add javadoc for all command classes
Move bot logo text to prompter class so it is more organised
Refactor strings in prompter to static constants
Convert prompter building methods to static methods
Use static constant values to store bot responses
commitResults.messageBody:
This is so that we have all the response messages in one place so it
is easy to change and modify if necessary.

commitResults.messageTitle: Use abstraction provided by the task manager class instead
Move responsibility of saving tasks to task manager
Add task storage class to handle saving and loading tasks
commitResults.messageBody:
This allows for better abstraction and handling of responsibilities
within the chatbot, and allows further extensibility with different
types of task storages that can be done by just extending this class.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add javadoc comments for all task manager methods
Add some assertions to ensure correct state of code

commitResults.messageTitle: Ensure formatted date for deadline has capital AM/PM
commitResults.messageBody:
This is because when testing on linux systems the output date time
string is shown as uppercase, whereas on my local system (macos) 
it is shown as lowercase.

commitResults.messageBody:
This is currently hard-coded for now, but in future it may instead
compute itself from the list of registered commands accordingly,
and be auto-updated whenever new commands are added.
